Can we get a fix for this NPE ?
Can we get it for EMF 2.0.4 ?

Hi Christophe,

I am having a hard time trying to understand how this NPE is happening.  If it
is not easy for you to attach a JUnit test case reproducing the problem, maybe
we chould meet on Wednesday so you could show me what you are doing.

Marcelo,
yep we are trying to get a testcase
We believe the error is in the caller and we are trying to reproduce
If this is not a known issue, we will try to get a testcase
Possibly we will be able to fix from the caller but yet :) .. it will be great
to not have a NPE when the caller cals with bad parameters :)

We will let you know

I am returning this defect as invalid since this is not a known problem.  Please
feel free to reopen it if you have a test case.

In EMF (most of it, at least), a list never contains null elements and a method
returning a list will always return a non-null value.  Since this is the case
for eAdapter() (see SDOUtil.java:508), I believe the client code is causing the
NPE by doing something that violates one of these "constraints".
